Package com.example.recipeoop_1.repository

Interface RecipeRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Recipe,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Recipe,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Recipe,String>, org.springframework.data.mongodb.repository.MongoRepository<Recipe,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Recipe,String>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Recipe>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Recipe,String>
@Repository public interface RecipeRepository extends org.springframework.data.mongodb.repository.MongoRepository<Recipe,String>
Spring Data MongoDB repository interface for Recipe entities.

This interface extends MongoRepository, providing standard CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for Recipe objects. It also defines custom query methods for finding recipes based on various criteria such as creator, title, category, and cooking time.

Note: While this repository is defined for a default "recipes" collection (as per Recipe()), the actual data storage might be distributed across multiple category-specific collections (e.g., "recipe_desserts", "recipe_maincourse") by the service layer (e.g., RecipeServiceImpl). This repository's methods, especially the custom @Query ones, might be intended for use with a MongoTemplate against specific collection names rather than direct invocation if recipes are indeed stored in separate collections per category. If recipes are in a single collection, these methods would work as standard Spring Data derived queries or custom queries. The Javadoc for each method assumes it operates on a collection containing Recipe documents that match the query criteria.

Since:
2025-05-14

  • Method Details

    • findByCreatedBy

      org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Recipe> findByCreatedBy(String username, org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable)
      Finds a paginated list of recipes created by a specific user.

      This method derives its query from the method name and parameters. It searches for Recipe documents where the createdBy field matches the provided username.

      Parameters:
      username - The username of the creator whose recipes are to be retrieved.
      pageable - A Pageable object specifying pagination information (page number, size, sort order).
      Returns:
      A Page of Recipe objects created by the specified user, respecting the pagination parameters.

    • findByTitleContainingIgnoreCase

      @Query("{\'title\': {$regex: ?0, $options: \'i\'}}") List<Recipe> findByTitleContainingIgnoreCase(String title)
      Finds recipes whose titles contain the given keyword, ignoring case.

      This method uses a custom MongoDB query defined by the Query annotation. The query performs a regular expression search (case-insensitive) on the title field.

      The MongoDB query is: {'title': {$regex: ?0, $options: 'i'}} where ?0 is a placeholder for the first method parameter (the title).
      Parameters:
      title - The keyword to search for within recipe titles.
      Returns:
      A list of Recipe objects whose titles contain the keyword. Returns an empty list if no matches are found.

    • findByCategoryContainingIgnoreCase

      @Query("{\'category\': {$regex: ?0, $options: \'i\'}}") List<Recipe> findByCategoryContainingIgnoreCase(String category)
      Finds recipes belonging to a category whose name contains the given keyword, ignoring case.

      This method uses a custom MongoDB query defined by the Query annotation. The query performs a regular expression search (case-insensitive) on the category field.

      The MongoDB query is: {'category': {$regex: ?0, $options: 'i'}} where ?0 is a placeholder for the first method parameter (the category).
      Parameters:
      category - The keyword to search for within recipe category names.
      Returns:
      A list of Recipe objects whose category names contain the keyword. Returns an empty list if no matches are found.

    • findByCookingTimeLessThanEqual

      List<Recipe> findByCookingTimeLessThanEqual(Integer cookingTime)
      Finds recipes whose cooking time is less than or equal to the specified number of minutes.

      This method derives its query from the method name. It searches for Recipe documents where the cookingTime field is less than or equal to the provided value.

      Parameters:
      cookingTime - The maximum cooking time in minutes.
      Returns:
      A list of Recipe objects that meet the cooking time criteria. Returns an empty list if no such recipes are found.
